comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: No Wikipedia entry, but he's mentioned in passing as the Italian foreign minister in 1909: October 24, 1909 (Sunday) At the Italian city of Racconigi, Tsar Nicholas II of Russia was hosted by King Victor Emmanuel III. The foreign ministers the two nations, Tomasso Tittoni and Aleksandr Izvolsky, exchanged diplomatic notes on an informal agreement for Russia and Italy to support each other's interests in the Balkans and in the Ottoman Empire.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I did find a wikipedia entry, with a different spelling. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tommaso_Tittoni It looks as though he was the Italian ambassador to France at the outbreak of WW1.
